impersonate:hud:tip.title: Navigating as another user
impersonate:hud:tip.description.1:
From now on, you will have access to the user's view. Your actions will not impact progress, edits, and creations, but you will be able to visualize the same messages, information, and content that they will see.

Please note that when 'Navigating' from the User's profile, you will access the Dashboard; however, when 'Navigating' from the Classes, the access will be directed to the corresponding Classroom.

This perspective will allow you to understand the needs and challenges faced by the user during their journey.

solutions.type:presential.description: Represents learning where the user can be physically present at the unit, but the learning process occurs online on the platform.
solutions.type:distance.description: Represents learning where the user's journey takes place entirely on the platform.
solutions.type:hybrid.description:
For courses that combine online and in-person learning.

Approval/disapproval control doesn't apply. It only applies if the online stage is completed.

Student statuses are: 'Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Expired', or 'Dropped Out'.

Assessment grades are visible after the completion period, under 'Corrections'.

The platform provides only a participation certificate.
solutions.type:online_with_tutoring.desc:
Represents the course with tutoring, which is available through the tools available in the Classroom, to assist users with questions related to the course contents.

Additionally, Users have the support of the monitoring team at their disposal, to help with questions regarding access and use of the tools available in the Classroom.
solutions.type:online_self_instructional:
It represents learning in which the user can conduct their studies with autonomy and independently.

A feature of the course is the absence of tutoring to clarify doubts about the contents.

However , during the duration of the course, users are supported by the monitoring team for clarifications related to accessing and using the tools available in the Classroom.

mediation.creation:type.hint:
The PM of the “Classes” type is responsible for triggering actions for the classes. This type of PM can be created manually by the manager or automatically by Studion.mx.< br>
The “Solutions” type PM acts as a PM model, that is, whenever a class is created, from a Solution that has a linked (published) PM, a Classes type PM will be automatically created ( for the created class), so that the shots can occur, considering the Class PM.

Reference Period: Defines which ground zero will be used by the filter to increase or decrease the number of days defined (Between +30 and -30) .

Ex.. If the end of class/enrollment date is the 27th and decreases by 2 days (-2) the action will be carried out on the 25th.

Days for Reference: Defines the number of days that must be increased or decreased.

community.sessions.modal:change.status.c: This change will cause the user to appear as Not started in the system reports and when viewing their classrooms. Progress will not be affected, but the student will lose access to the certificates of this class, if any.
This change will cause the user to appear as In progress and, if they do not meet the requirements, lose access to the certificate of completion (if the solution issues this type of certificate).
This change will cause the user to appear as Approved, which will generate a certificate of completion for the student, if available, and they will appear as a course graduate.

Changing the student's status to Reproved will cause the student to lose access to the certificate of completion for this class (if applicable), and will appear as a failing student in this solution in reports.

Changing the student's status to Expired will cause the student to lose access to the certificate of completion for this class (if applicable), and will appear as a not completing student in this solution in reports.
Changing the student status to Dropout will remove any certificates related to this class.
Changing the student status to Accomplished, you will be indicating that they have completed all mandatory evaluations and have the same status as those who have already accomplished them.

trails.users:modal.solution.status.confi: This change will cause the user to appear as Unstarted in system reports and when viewing their classrooms. Progress will not be affected, but the student will lose access to the certificates of this solution if they have.
This change will cause the user to appear as In Progress and, if they don't meet the requirements, lose access to the certificate of completion (if the solution issues this type of certificate).
This change will cause the user to appear as Approved,which will generate a certificate of completion for the student, if available, and he will appear as a course finisher.

Changing the student's status to Disapproved will cause them to lose access to the certificate of completion for this solution (if applicable), and will appear as a disapproved student in this solution in the reports.

Changing the student's status to Expired will cause them to lose access to the certificate of completion for this solution (if applicable), and will appear as a non-completing student in this solution in the reports.

Changing the student's status to Dropout will cause them to lose access to the certificate of completion for this solution (if applicable), and will appear as a dropout student in this solution in the reports.

You chose to do the pre-project yourself.
pre.project.panel.group:modal.orientatio:
Attention!

The pre-project can be carried out in pairs or individually, both options are available to choose from, according to the following rules:

Button “{btnAlone}”:
  • Available to all students in the class. Once this option is selected, it will NOT be possible to reverse it.
  • After selecting this option, the student will NOT be available to form a group (pair) with another classmate.

Button “{btnNewGroup}”:
  • Available to students who have not yet been chosen as a pair by another classmate.
  • After you create the group (pair), you will not be able to reverse the option. If you want to undo the pair, the chosen colleague must choose the option “Leave the Group (pair)”.
  • Once the pair is disbanded, you will be able to choose again between doing it individually or selecting another colleague to carry out the pre-project in pairs.

Button “{btnLeaveGroup}”:
  • Available only to students who were chosen as a pair by another classmate. The name of the classmate who entered you as a pair will be displayed.
  • After leaving the group you will have the option to create a new group (pair) or do it individually. After leaving the group (pair), your name will be available to be selected by another classmate.

Additional Information:
  • You will only have access to your version of the pre-project after choosing the form of implementation, individually or in a group (pair).
  • You will be able to access the pre-project version as many times as necessary to complete it until the final date scheduled for completion.
  • If you choose to do the Pre-Project in pairs, so that both participants have their frequency and score recorded, each member must send the same Pre-Project through individual access.
  • Your answers are automatically saved when filling out the pre-project fields. You can request, via Message or Ask Questions, that your Remote Tutor check your answers and guide you in the construction of this activity at any time. Before finishing it: the tutor will have access to what you are developing in the VLE and will accompany you, so pay attention to the tips received via Message.
  • After completing the registration of all the information in your pre-project, click on the “Reply” button to have it sent for correction. After this action, it will not be possible to edit your version of the pre-project, so seek guidance from Distance Tutoring before finalizing, thus ensuring more assertive delivery.
  • Your grade and feedback will be available once the submitted version of the pre-project has been fully corrected.
